title: My Shadow is Purple

cover.alt: Book cover showing an early-grade white masculine-looking child with brown hair, round glases, a blue shirt, and hands in pockets of green pants.  The child is casting a shadow showing a purple silhouette of someone with outstretched arms, a bow tie, and a frilled skirt.  Text above the figures read 'My Shadow is PURPLE'  Below the figures, text says 'Written & illustrated by SCOTT STUART'.

overview: This is an illustrated children's book that 'considers gender beyond binary in a vibrant spectrum of colour'. It was shortlisted for the Australian Book Industry Awards in 2023, under the category Small Publishers Children's Book of the Year.

incidents.description: In Cobb County, Katie Rinderle read this book to her fifth grade gifted class, at their request, only to be {ln:https://www.splcenter.org/news/2023/06/22/georgia-teacher-fired-reading-childrens-book-about-acceptance-class|unexpectly fired} after school officials reported hearing a complaint about the book from some parents. The Southern Poverty Law Center reports 'Rinderle is the first known public school teacher to be fired under Georgia’s trio of censorship laws passed in 2022.... Together, the laws censor class discussion, give parents the right to refuse instruction they disagree with and ban 'offensive' reading materials from school libraries.'
